task_description: Facing the building to your North-West (approx. 328°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full height of the building to estimate it, so I will first look up to find the roof.
I have seen the top of the building, and now I need to look down to see its base to get a sense of the full height.

Having viewed the top and bottom of the building, I can now estimate its height by counting the floors; it appears to have a taller ground floor (around 4m) and 6 standard floors above (around 3m each), totaling approximately 22 meters.
